Package com.w10.risk_game.controllers

Class GamePlayController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.w10.risk_game.controllers.GamePlayController
  • public class GamePlayController
extends Object
    The GamePlayController class is responsible for managing players, issuing orders, executing orders and their interactions in a game.
    Author:
    Sherwyn Dsouza

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean assignCountries()
      The function assigns countries to players in a game, ensuring that each player owns a certain number of countries.
      boolean assignPlayersReinforcements()
      The function assigns reinforcements to players in a game, based on the game map.
      boolean checkIfGameCanBegin()
      The function checks if the game can begin by verifying if the map is created, there are at least two players, and countries have been assigned.
      boolean checkIfGameIsOver()
      The function checks if the game is over by iterating through all countries and checking if they have the same owner.
      boolean checkIfOrdersCanBeExecuted()
      The function checks if there are any players in the player list.
      boolean checkIfOrdersCanBeIssued()
      The function checks if the current player has any leftover armies and removes them from the player list if they don't, then returns true if there are leftover armies and false otherwise.
      void createPlayer​(String p_playerName)
      The function creates a player with a given name and adds it to a map of players, checking for duplicate names.
      boolean executePlayerOrders()
      The function executes the orders of the players in a specific order and then re-initializes variables for the next turn.
      Player getCurrentPlayer()
      The function getCurrentPlayer() returns the current player.
      Integer getNoOfPlayers()
      The function returns the number of players in a game.
      static List<Order> GetOtherOrders()
      The function returns a list of other orders.
      Player getPlayerDetails​(String p_playerName)
      The function returns the details of a player based on their name.
      static List<Player> GetPlayerListForDiplomacy()
      The function returns the list of players in a game.
      String getWinner()
      The function "getWinner" returns the winner of a game.
      void issuePlayerOrder()
      The function "issuePlayerOrder" updates the current player and calls the "issueOrder" method for the current player.
      void removePlayer​(String p_playerName)
      The function removes a player from a list of players in a game engine.
      static void SetOtherOrders​(List<Order> p_otherOrders)
      The function sets the value of a static variable called "OtherOrders" to the provided list of Order objects.
      void SetPlayerListForDiplomacy​(List<Player> p_playerListForDiplomacy)
      The function sets the list of players in a game.
      void showAllPlayers()
      The function "showAllPlayers" prints the names of all players and the countries they own.
      void showMap()
      The function "showMap" calls the "showMap" method of the "d_mapEditorController" object.

        The function removes a player from a list of players in a game engine.
        Parameters:
        p_playerName - The parameter "p_playerName" is a String that represents the name of the player that needs to be removed.

        public void showAllPlayers()

      • checkIfGameCanBegin

        public boolean checkIfGameCanBegin()
        The function checks if the game can begin by verifying if the map is created, there are at least two players, and countries have been assigned.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value.

      • issuePlayerOrder

        public void issuePlayerOrder()
        The function "issuePlayerOrder" updates the current player and calls the "issueOrder" method for the current player.

      • checkIfOrdersCanBeIssued

        public boolean checkIfOrdersCanBeIssued()
        The function checks if the current player has any leftover armies and removes them from the player list if they don't, then returns true if there are leftover armies and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value.

      • checkIfOrdersCanBeExecuted

        public boolean checkIfOrdersCanBeExecuted()
        The function checks if there are any players in the player list. If empty, it returns True so that no more players have to issue orders and order execution can begin by the game engine
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value.

      • executePlayerOrders

        public boolean executePlayerOrders()
        The function executes the orders of the players in a specific order and then re-initializes variables for the next turn.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value. If the execution of the player orders is successful, it returns true. If there is an exception during the execution, it returns false.

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public Player getCurrentPlayer()
        The function getCurrentPlayer() returns the current player.
        Returns:
        The method is returning the current player.

      • showMap

        public void showMap()
        The function "showMap" calls the "showMap" method of the "d_mapEditorController" object.

      • checkIfGameIsOver

        public boolean checkIfGameIsOver()
        The function checks if the game is over by iterating through all countries and checking if they have the same owner.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value.

      • getWinner

        public String getWinner()
        The function "getWinner" returns the winner of a game.
        Returns:
        The method is returning the value of the variable "d_winner".
